Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CWR 3201 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of basic principles of fluids at rest and in motion to analysis and design of hydraulic systems. Empirical relationships for practical engineering problems.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: STA 3032 and CWR 3201 both with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Descriptive and quantitative aspect of water in the earth's environment and its engineering implications, including analysis of surface water systems, design of hydraulic structures, and stormwater management.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CWR 4202C and CEG 4011C both with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamentals of subsurface flow and transport, role of groundwater in the hydrologic cycle, relation of groundwater flow to geologic structure, and management of contaminated groundwater.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CWR 4202C and STA 3032 both with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Occurrence, distribution, and properties of fresh water on Earth and movement via physical processes. Application of hydrology, fluid mechanics, and computation to water resources.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, EGN 3310 both with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamentals of fluid mechanics with hydraulic applications: fluid properties, hydrostatics, dimensional analysis, energy, momentum, continuity, and steady flow.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CWR 4632C with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provision of advanced understanding of hydrology, hydrologic river routing, open/closed channel, and groundwater hydraulic and some engineering applications of these concepts.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CWR 4120 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better and department consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Project course for the design of storm water, potable and sewer transmission systems using local and state regulations.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science
